column4: My ubuntu (edgy) stops during boot. It say it cant mount root and then say something about initramfs? Can someone point me in some direction?
I should add that it was almost a fresh install and I am running dualboot with XP

I have dualboot, XP and Edgy. I installed Edgy today and it worked great until I rebboted into windows and then back to edgy. I get "/bin/sh: can't access tty; job control turned off". Does windows alter my boot partition?
installing xp, or just booting it?
just booting it.
that's quite odd.
no, I doubt that's at all relevant
what happens when you boot?  do you get the grub menu?
Yes I get the Grub and I can select ubuntu or win
ok, and what happens when you select linux?
mzli: right after ubuntu splash: "/bin/sh: can't access tty; job control turned off"
hmm, sounds like your /dev directory might be screwed up.  or part of the kernel.
most likely you can boot a live cd and fix it, but it would take some time to figure out exactly what to fix.
yes Im finding something about this in the forums, Im not at that computer atm but Im gonna try it tomorrow.
ok.  we can't really be very specific, there are too many possibilities
yes but I hope that I only have to modify the grub list
unlikely, unless you somehow changed it.  I assume you mean the grub config file, which is menu.lst
of course, something unlikely did happen, but it's pretty hard to change your menu.lst file accidentally without clobbering it entirely.
Yes but I saw that on the forums that it happend to some people. One of them even after booting windows on a dualboot...
ok, still seems unlikely, but we'll see what happens.
it's easy to get confused about whether something is really caused by booting another o/s.  It almost never really is.
